items.sentence: Didn\'t you know I was hoping Tom would do that?
Tom bought this house after his father\'s death.
I promise I won\'t tell anyone that Tom is here.
I really wish I could go with you, but I can\'t.
You should spend more time studying than you do.
Tom went back to bed as if nothing had happened.
Tom will finish serving his sentence next month.
Tom will probably tell you the same thing I did.
Tom wondered how many pairs of shoes Mary owned.
Tom hopes to meet Mary again in the near future.
I often slept on that bench when I was homeless.
I own a house in Boston, but Chicago is my home.
I plan to study this afternoon after I get home.
A string quartet is rehearsing in the next room.
It was so hot that I slept with the window open.
It will be a long time before I can buy a house.
I don\'t see why Tom wanted me to be here today.
I don\'t think Tom has enough money to buy that.
I suggested that we bring the meeting to an end.
Tom can hardly see anything without his glasses.
